title: paula_(mother_2)
body:
[b]JP[/b]: [code]ポーラ・ジョーンズ[/code] 
[b]EN[/b]: Paula Jones

A character from [[mother 2|MOTHER 2/EarthBound]].

Contrary to popular belief, Paula's last name is not Polestar, but rather it's Jones. The name of the preschool being Polestar is instead a pun on the Japanese spelling of her name (ポーラ Pōra) and the name of Polestar Preschool (ポーラスター Pōrasutaa), both of which share the same three katakana.

title: lectern
body:
A type of high desk that a person stands behind when speaking to an audience. Often used to [[teacher|teach a class]], give a speech, lecture, or sermon, or to hold a [[press conference]].

Sometimes called a [[podium]], but on Danbooru [[podium]] refers to a different type of platform.

title: aisin-gioro_puyi
body:
The last [[Chinese Empire|Emperor of China]], and final monarch of the [[Qing dynasty]]. Would later be declared Emperor of the Imperial Japanese puppet state of [[Manchukuo]]. Following the end of World War 2, he would remain imprisoned until 1959, when he had been released after "successful reeducation" and "Communist remodeling", with endorsement from the [[china|CCP]]. He was frequently targeted by the youth [[Red Guard]]s during the [[Cultural Revolution]], resulting in his health declining and dying in 1967.

Has seen renewed interest on [[TikTok]] as a result of Puyi impersonator "4lvi3yjy0":[https://www.tiktok.com/@4lvi3yjy0], dancing around China as Puyi, to the tune of Harry Styles' [i]As It Was[/i].
other_names: アイシンギョロ・プーイー

title: elizabeth_ii
body:
[b]Elizabeth Alexandra Mary[/b] of the House of Windsor (21 April 1926 - 8 September 2022)

The 12th monarch of the [[United Kingdom]] of Great Britain and Northern Ireland and head of the British Commonwealth. Her reign began in 1952. In September 2015 she became the longest reigning monarch of the United Kingdom and since October 2016, was the world's longest-reigning monarch. Elizabeth passed away peacefully on 8th September 2022 at the age of 96.
Her successor is Charles Windsor, her eldest son, who took on the royal name "[[Charles III]]".

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:People]]

h4. External links

title: sig_sg550
body:
The [b]SIG SG550[/B] 5.56×45mm NATO [[assault rifle]] designed and manufactured by [[SIG SAUER|Swiss Arms AG]] (former division of SIG Holding AG), adopted into service in 1990. It features a reciprocating charging handle, a [[folding stock]], an ambidextrous safety, closed bolt gas-actuated long-stroke piston mechanism and manually adjustable gas valve which make the [[rifle]] very reliable.

This tag can also apply to the slightly shorter SG551 variant, and the discontinued semi-auto only SG550-1 for [[sniper rifle|designated marksman]] role (with [[scope]] and [[bipod]]).

title: elesis_(elsword)
body:
[[Elsword]] character. [[elsword (character)|Elsword]]'s older sister, and a strong and calculating warrior who travels the world to improve her swordsmanship. Her disappearance is what motivates Elsword to go on his own journey. Her seiyuu is [[Inoue Marina]].

She used to be known by the name Elsa.

Elesis is heavily based on [[Elesis Sieghart]] from [[Grand Chase]], but [b]they are not the same character[/b] due to them having different backstories and living in different universes. However, because Grand Chase lists Elsword as her brother too, their lineage is considered identical across both games, and some fans see both incarnations of Elesis as one and the same. However, they are all to be treated as separate characters on Danbooru.

Class tree:
[[Free Knight (elsword)|]] > [[Saber Knight (elsword)|]] > [[Grand Master (elsword)|]] > [[Empire Sword (elsword)|]]
Free Knight > [[Pyro Knight (elsword)|]] > [[Blazing Heart (elsword)|]] > [[Flame Lord (elsword)|]]
Free Knight > [[Dark Knight (elsword)|]] > [[Crimson Avenger (elsword)|]] > [[Bloody Queen (elsword)|]]
Free Knight > [[Soar Knight (elsword)|]] > [[Patrona (elsword)|]] > [[Adrestia (elsword)|]]

title: add_(elsword)
body:
[[Elsword]] character, his true name is Edward Grenore. A boy coming from a family of nasod researchers in a time where anything related to nasods was forbidden. His family is caught researching and is killed. Add is sold to slavery but manages to escape. He ends up trapped alone inside an ancient library, causing him to become mentally unstable as a result. With the help of the information about nasods and broken nasod parts inside the library, Add creates the nasod Dynamo and manages to get out. Due to time flowing different inside the library, Add ends up in the future where Elsword's story takes place. He has an obsession with rare nasod codes that will allow him to return to the past. This causes him to target [[eve (elsword)|Eve]], the Queen of Nasods.

Apparently he likes [[cat]]s, as any classes with him wearing a [[hoodie]] will have [[animal hood|fake cat ears]]. His seiyuu is [[Kimura Ryouhei]].

Class tree:
[[Tracer (elsword)|]] > [[Psychic Tracer (elsword)|]] > [[Lunatic Psyker (elsword)|]] > [[Doom Bringer (elsword)|]]
Tracer > [[Arc Tracer (elsword)|]] > [[Mastermind (elsword)|]] > [[Dominator (elsword)|]]
Tracer > [[Time Tracer (elsword)|]] > [[Diabolic Esper (elsword)|]] > [[Mad Paradox (elsword)|]]
Tracer > [[Affect Tracer (elsword)|]] > [[Dissembler (elsword)|]] > [[Overmind (elsword)|]]

title: croupier
body:
A croupier or dealer is someone appointed at a gambling table to assist in the conduct of the game, especially in the distribution of bets and payouts. Croupiers are typically employed by casinos.

Originally a 'croupier' meant one who stood behind a gambler, with extra reserves of cash to back him up during a gambling session. The word derived from 'croup' (the rump of a horse) and was by way of analogy to one who rode behind on horseback. It later came to refer to one who was employed to collect the money from a gaming-table.

A female croupier's uniform usually consists of a shirt and tie with a [[vest]], and a [[miniskirt]] or slacks.

h4. See also

* [[tag_group:jobs]]

title: ultranationalists_(call_of_duty)
body:
A fictional Russian political party and paramilitary force, serving as the main enemy faction in [[call_of_duty_4|Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare]] and [[call_of_duty:_modern_warfare_2|Modern Warfare 2]]. Originally founded and led by [[Imran Zakhaev]], thus [[vladimir_r_makarov|Vladimir Makarov]] continued the leadership. Their ideology is radical Russian nationalism, while aiming to restore the power and might of the former [[soviet|Soviet Union]].

The Ultranationalists were also the major ally and arms supplier for the [[opfor (call of duty)|OpFor]] in the Middle East, which also helped to bring [[Khaled al-Asad]] into power.

title: m4_carbine
body:
The [B]M4 Carbine[/b] is an American 5.56mm NATO [[assault rifle]] introduced in 1994. It is based on the shorter and lighter version of the [[M16A2]]. 
This tag applies to all variants of the rifle, such as the M4 with SOPMOD II set of attachments, Mk 18 CQBR carbine with shorter upper receiver, and many more.

If you are seeing what appears to be M4-like rifle on images that takes place before the mid-1990s (i.e. during Vietnam War), the protruding barrel length is notably shorter in comparison with the forearm, or if the [[gun]] lacks more recent tactical features like Picatinny rails (post #6130843 for example) - then it is the [[Colt Commando]].

h4. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[M4A1 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[M4 SOPMOD II (Girls' Frontline)]]

title: skorpion_vz._61
body:
The [b]Škorpion vz. 61[/b] is a [[czech_republic|Czechoslovak]] compact [[submachine gun]] designed in the early 1960s, initially chambered in .32 ACP (7.65×17mmSR Browning), while later variants are available in 9mm Makarov, 9mm Parabellum and .380 ACP. It features a wire [[folding stock|top-folding stock]] and uses a standard 10/20-round magazine. 

The Škorpion was originally intended (an served mostly) as a compact sidearm for [[tank]] crews and other vehicle crews. Even today, it is in active service in the Czech [[military]] (now issued mainly to guards) and in elite [[police]] squads.

title: armd
body:
A fictional [[spacecraft]] from the [[MACROSS]] science fiction series.

The [b]ARMD Class Space Carrier[/b] (ARMD being an acronym for [b]A[/b]rmaments [b]R[/b]igged-up [b]M[/b]oving [b]D[/b]eck) is a human built warship designed as [[space]] carrier for [[variable fighter]]s and other [[U.N. Spacy]] [[mecha]].

Built by OTEC Company, the ARMD carriers featured OverTechnology with gravity control systems, a reaction heat pile system and even a fold drive (though this hyperspace navigation system was never implemented in actual combat). At 0.4 km in length, the ARMD carriers were much smaller than the large [[SDF-1]] "Macross" and both ARMD-01 and ARMD-02 were originally meant to dock with the larger craft when the ship achieved orbit during its maiden voyage.

As a carrier vessel, the ARMDs held numerous ships and mecha. ARMD-01 held 78 SF-A3 Lancer II space fighters and 270 [[QF-3000E]] [[Ghost drone]] fighters (as well as an unknown number of [[VF-1]] variable fighters) just prior to [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross|Space War I]] (the events of [i]Super Dimension Fortress Macross[/i]). 

In addition to several hundred fighters, the ARMD carrier was armed with many weapons including beam cannons, small anti-aircraft cannons and [[missile]] launchers as well as several anti-ship medium sized and large missiles with multiple [[nuclear weapon|reaction warheads]]. 

The ARMD possessed many large [[vernier thrusters]] nozzles positioned all over the craft. These powerful [[thrusters]] granted the ARMD excellent maneuverability in space and also proved very useful for combat engagement and evasion.

In [[real life]] this ship was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early [[1980s_(style)|80s]] for the first Macross TV series. The ship was renamed the [b]Armor Class Space Carrier[/b] in the [[Robotech]] adaptation from 1985.

title: dunhuang_style
body:
[b]Dunhuang style[/b] refers to the art, fashion, and culture depicted in the Dunhuang Murals of China, which are located in the Mogao Caves in Dunhuang, Gansu Province. Outfits following Dunhuang style are often inspired by "Feitian"/"apsara":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apsara] – beautiful flying celestials in [[Buddhism]] who are skilled in music and dance. These costumes typically consist of items like [[bandeau]], [[pants]], and [[shawl]] that are influenced by [[Indian clothes]].

title: battletech
body:
[i][b]BattleTech[/b][/i] is a long-running American wargaming [[military]] [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] franchise launched by FASA Corporation in 1984, acquired by WizKids in 2000, and owned since 2003 by "Topps":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Topps company.

The game was heavily influenced by real [[robot]] anime like [[Gundam]] and [[Macross]]. It is set predominantly in the 31st Century, where humanity has colonized numerous star systems, but is divided among a number of feudal "Great Houses" and various minor states after its ruling government, the Star League, collapsed several centuries prior. War is a frequent occurrence and is often waged with BattleMechs at the forefront, giant robots that are treated more akin to walking tanks than the ultimate weapon. 

The series began with FASA's debut of the mid-80s [[board game]] [i]BattleTech[/i] (originally named [i]BattleDroids[/i]) by Jordan Weisman and L. Ross Babcock III. 

It has since grown to include numerous expansions to the original game, several computer and home [[game_console|console]] [[video game]]s, a collectible card game, a series of more than 100 novels, an animated television series and more.

While Battletech initially used licensed designs from [i][[Taiyou no Kiba Dougram]][/i] and [i][[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]][/i], these were later replaced with original designs.

Relatively well-known titles in Japan are:

* Tabletop role-playing game (Japanese: メックウォリアーRPG; sometimes called メックウォリアーTRPG)
* [b][i]MechWarrior[/i][/b] (1989 video game) (Super Famicom: バトルテック / PC-98 & X68000: バトルテック ~奪われた聖杯~ released in 1992 in Japan simply as [b][i]Battletech[/i][/b])

title: quiltra-queleual
body:
A fictional, massive [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[MACROSS]] [[science fiction]] series.

The [b]Quiltra-Queleual Class Landing Ship Tank[/b] like nearly all [[Zentradi]] ships of the line, has been in active service for hundreds of millennia. 

Another product of the war machines used during the ancient Schism War of the old [[Protoculture]] Stellar Republic, the Quiltra-Queleual serves the role of a planetary assault ship. More than any of the other Zentradi capital ships, this vessel devotes the vast majority of internal volume to [[mecha]] bays and hangars for [[Regult]] battle pods, [[Gnerl]] fighters and re-entry craft. 

This ship features several launching hatches for efficient deployment including a large re-entry pod [[hatch]] in its bow. While not specifically designed for ship-to-ship combat, the Quiltra-Queleual still features a moderate number of anti-ship and anti-fighter [[energy cannon]]s and [[missile]] weapons for attack and defense. 

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

title: ishihara_shintarou
body:
Right-wing ultranationalist Japanese politician who served as Governor of Tokyo from 1999 to 2012. In otaku circles, he's remembered as the leading figure behind the revision of Tokyo's Youth Ordinance Bill (which restricts the sale of 'problematic goods' to minors), otherwise known as Bill 156, to include manga, anime, and non-real life photographs, which passed in 2010, garnering mass backlash from the affected industries, with failed attempts by otaku politicians to reverse it since.

He passed away in 2022 at the age of 89.

title: dunkirk_evacuation
body:
[b]The Dunkirk Evacuation[/b], codenamed [b]Operation Dynamo[/b] and also known as [b]The Miracle of Dunkirk[/b], or simply [b]Dunkirk[/b], was the evacuation of more than 338,000 Allied soldiers during the early part of [[World War II]] from the beaches and harbour of Dunkirk, in the north of [[France]], between 26 May and 4 June 1940. 

The operation commenced after large numbers of Belgian, [[united_kingdom|British]], and French troops were cut off and surrounded by [[germany|German]] troops during the six-week [[Battle of France]]. In a speech to the House of Commons, British Prime Minister [[Winston Churchill]] called this "a colossal military disaster", saying "the whole root and core and brain of the British Army" had been stranded at Dunkirk and seemed about to be destroyed or captured. 

In his "We shall fight on the beaches":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/We_shall_fight_on_the_beaches speech on 4 June, after the operation had successfully ended, he hailed their rescue as [i]"a miracle of deliverance...".[/i]

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dunkirk_evacuation

title: dragon_ball_super_broly
body:
[b]Dragon Ball Super Broly[/b] is the twentieth movie in the [[Dragon Ball]] franchise and the first to carry the [[Dragon Ball Super]] branding, as well as the third Dragon Ball film personally supervised by creator [[Toriyama Akira]], following [[dragon ball z kami to kami|Battle of Gods]] (2013) and [[dragon ball z fukkatsu no f|Resurrection 'F']] (2015). 

The film takes place after the Universe Survival Saga depicted in Dragon Ball Super. Under the tagline "the greatest enemy, Saiyan", the film depicts the fate of series protagonist [[Son Goku]] and [[Vegeta]] as they encounter a new Saiyan called [[Broly (Dragon Ball Super)|]]. The movie's prologue also adapts the spinoff [[Dragon Ball Minus]], a retelling of Goku's origin, including the connection of the [[Frieza]] army and the history of the Saiyans.

This also marked the first time Broly was a film personally written by the series creator, thus making him canon in the Dragon Ball universe.

[b]Directed by[/b]: Tatsuya Nagamine
[b]Screenplay by[/b]: Akira Toriyama
[b]Produced by[/b]: Toei Animation 
[b]Release date[/b]: December 14, 2018 (Japan)

title: aren't_they_all_the_same_(meme)
body:
[i]Zenbu onaji janai desuka[/i]

Parody of a chapter from [[Kochikame]].

[[Ryoutsu Kankichi|Ryotsu]] shares his collection of Omen Rider (parody of [[Kamen Rider]]) figures with fellow enthusiast [[Honda Hayato|Honda]]. [[Nakagawa Keiichi|Nakagawa]], who is unfamiliar with the series, then says the eponymous line "Aren't they all the same?", causing the other two to retort:

"No, they're not!"

"That's why amateurs are no good! Look closely!"

title: queadluun-rau
body:
[[Zentradi]] one-man tactical aerospace [[alien]] [[power armor]] that first appeared in [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] science fiction anime TV series from 1982.

The [[Quimeliquola]] [b]Queadluun-Rau[/b], also known as the [b]Q-Rau[/b], is one of the most advanced and dangerous Zentradi [[mecha]]. It is very fast, heavy armored and highly maneuverable thanks to its inertia vector control system, several [[vernier thrusters]] and advanced thermonuclear reactor. 

This power armor is armed with two mid-range energy cannons on its torso, two triple-barreled rapid fire energy [[arm cannon]]s on its forearms, two micro-missile launchers on its back and two on its legs with dozens of missiles each. Because of its characteristics and weaponry, this mecha is used mostly in enemy fighter interception and long range aggressive-reconaissance roles, rather than anti-capital ship combat. 

The Q-Rau is the mecha of choice for Zentradi [[starfighter]] aces such as [[Millia Jenius]].

In the original 1982 Macross TV series the mecha was used by the female fleets of the Zentradi armada, while in the 1984 film adaptation of the series, [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] the Q-Rau was used by the [[Meltrandi]] fleet (enemies of the Zentradi fleet) only.   

In [[real life]] the Queadluun-Rau was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

h4. See also

title: eitr_(fire_emblem)
body:
A character introduced in Fire Emblem: Heroes in the Tempest Trail + story "Dreams and Nihility" She's an unquestioning servant of the ruler of nothingness who lacks the confidence to express her own will.

Later on, it's revealed that she's a younger Frejya, reincarnated by Ginnungagap and wiped of her memories, then creating a dream-eater of Freyja to kill, making the álfar lose all hope and believe that not even Freyja can defeat the nothingness this time.

After Ginnungagap's defeat, at the request of Peony, Freyja recreated Eitr as a separate being from herself in the Dream World so she and the álfar could remain friends.

title: shin_(hokuto_no_ken)
body:
[b]Shin[/b] ([b]シン[/b])  is [[Kenshiro]]'s first major adversary in [[Hokuto no Ken]] series. Shin represents the Star of Martyrdom (殉星, Junsei) and is the successor of the Nanto Koshu Ken (南斗孤鷲拳, "South Star Lone Eagle Fist") style.

Shin was initially Kenshiro's friend and rival, who secretly desired Kenshiro's fiance [[Yuria (Hokuto no Ken)|]] from afar, but knew Yuria's heart was for Kenshiro and gave up to pursue her. After some motivation [spoiler]from [[Jagi]][/spoiler], Shin challenged Kenshiro, after destroying Ryuken's grave stone, and defeated him, engraving the seven scars on his chest afterwards; subsequently taking off with Yuria by force.

After his first fight with Kenshiro, Shin formed the "King's Army" consists of outlaws ranging from Nanto Seiken users to brutish thugs. His army conquered a city that Shin later named it "Southern Cross", where he ruled as an oppressive tyrant who often committed various atrocities in the name of Yuria, much to her distraught and frustration. 

h4. Known moves

* 南斗獄屠拳 ([i][[Nanto Gokuto Ken]][/i])
** A flying kick which temporarily disables the enemy by cutting the joints in their arms and legs. Known for its iconic pose of having one leg folded in, one leg pointed out and arms extended while in the air.

* 南斗千首龍撃 ([i]Nanto Senshu Ryugeki[/i])
** A series of rapid hand stabbing techniques.

* 南斗飛竜拳 ([i]Nanto Hiryu Ken[/i])
** A series of rapid fist strikes. The result of the attack makes his enemy crack all over like rock before Shin deals a finishing blow.

title: tea_strainer
body:
A type of strainer that is placed over or in a teacup to catch loose tea leaves.

When tea is brewed in the traditional manner in a teapot, the tea leaves are not contained in teabags; rather, they are freely suspended in the water. As the leaves themselves are not consumed with the tea, it is usual to filter them out with a tea strainer. Strainers usually fit into the top of the cup to catch the leaves as the tea is poured.

[i][[Adventure Time]][/i] character.
[[Simon Petrikov]]'s girlfriend, who mysteriously vanished one day. [spoiler]She is the reason why the [[Ice King]] is obsessed with princesses, as it's a mutation of his nickname for Betty. title: chokha
body:
A type of overcoat that is part of the traditional clothing of people from the Caucasus, such as Georgians, Circassians, and Chechens, among others, as well as other groups that have interacted with them, like Russian Cossacks.

They are most recognizable from the attached [[gazyr|gazyrs]] - several fabric tubes lined up side-by-side in a row on the breast, formerly used to hold rifle charges, but now mainly decorative. Chokhas also characteristically have a v-shaped or triangular neckline that is often very deep, in many cases extending down to the breasts, exposing the wearer's shirt (usually [[dress shirt|button-up]]) underneath. The bottom hem of a chokha is generally pleated and extends down far enough to cover the knees, but not touch the ground. They may be any color, but are prototypically black or some other dark color.

title: fairy_leviathan_(mega_man)
body:
Fairy Leviathan, known in the Japanese version as Siren General Leviathan, or simply Leviathan, is a member of the Four Guardians of Neo Arcadia in the [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]] series. She was created from [[X (mega Man)|]]'s DNA data after the Maverick Wars to clean the world's oceans. Leviathan's schematics are based off X's capabilites of underwater combat. Some time later, she became a military general of Neo Arcadia, commanding the Deep Sea Squadron, Neo Arcadia's navy force. she makes an appearance in [[Mega Man ZX]] and [[mega man zx advent|Mega Man ZX Advent]] as [[model l (mega man)|Biometal Model L]].

h4. See also

* [[Splash Woman]]

title: inoue_orihime
body:
One of the main female characters of [[Bleach]]. She is the originator of the [[leekspin (meme)|]] meme, in which she spins a grocery-bought [[spring onion]].

She has [[long hair]] that is either [[orange hair|orange]] or [[brown hair|brown]] depending on the artist with [[parted bangs]], [[brown eyes]] and noticeably [[large breasts]].

During the events of [[bleach:_sennen_kessen-hen|Bleach: The Thousand-Year Blood War]] her [[casual]] clothes are a combination of a [[sleeveless hoodie]], [[short shorts]] and [[thighhighs]] while her new combat outfit consisting of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[white shirt]] with [[vertical-striped_shirt|stripes]] and a [[cleavage cutout]], [[detached sleeves]] and a [[long skirt|long]] [[white skirt]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Orihime Inoue":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orihime_Inoue

title: haineko_(shikai)
body: The Zanpakuto of [[matsumoto rangiku]], Squad 10 Lieutenant in the popular anime/manga Bleach. Haineko has the ability to turn Rangiku's blade into ash, which will then spread around her opponents, then with a flick of her wrist, the ash is able to cut as if it was her sword. However, the less ash is on/near an opponent when Rangiku slashes, the less damage it will do.

title: ashisogi_jizou_(shikai)
body: The Shikai of Captain [[Kurotsuchi Mayuri|]] of the popular series [[bleach]]. The zanpakuto release command is "Claw out", and it takes the form of a golden tri-blade sword with a baby head at the base. The shikai's ability is that when it cuts it's opponent, they will become paralyzed and unable to move on their own.

title: true_zangetsu_(shikai)
body: An evolved form of [[zangetsu (shikai)|Zangetsu]] in [[Bleach: Sennen Kessen-hen]].

title: sakanade_(shikai)
body: The Zanpakuto of [[hirako shinji]] from the series Bleach. Sakanade has the ability to emit a mist that reverses all of the opponents senses, making up into down, left into right, forward into backward, etc. One other feature shown is being able to reverse words that Hirako says.

title: suzumebachi_(shikai)
body: The Shikai of Sui-Feng (Soi-Fon), the captain of Squad 2 and leader of the punishment squad from Bleach. Suzumebachi has the ability to place a butterfly shaped crest called a Homonka onto her enemies when she stabs them. If she places a homonka, and then stabs the enemy in the same place again, the Homonka will grow and destroy their body, killing them.

title: overblot
body:
A worldbuilding and gameplay mechanic in [[Twisted Wonderland]].

When a magician uses too much of their magic and lets negative emotions consolidate into their magic wands, blot accumulates. Too much blot leads to Overblot, and the character in question projects a monstrous image that must be calmed down. Visually and gameplay wise, they function as the "boss forms" of certain characters, normally fought at the end of main story chapters.

title: gurerulin
body:
A [[youkai (youkai watch)|youkai]] in [[Youkai Watch]]. His name is a combination of [i]gureru[/i] (グレる) "turn bad" and [i]guremurin[/i] (グレムリン) "gremlin".

A [[delinquent]] youkai. Has [[pointy ears]], [[green skin]], and [[orange hair]] worn in a [[pompadour]]. Wears a [[sarashi]] and [[purple pants]] but [[topless male|no shirt]]. Is typically seen [[squatting]] with his [[tongue out]].

Evolves into [[Gokudoo]]. Fuses with [[Jibanyan]] to produce [[Warunyan]].

title: qcw-05
body:
The [B]QCW-05[/B] is a Chinese [[bullpup]] [[submachine gun]] developed by the [[People's Liberation Army]] 208 Research Institute and Jianshe Industries (Group) Corporation of Chongqing. It features an open bolt design, a charging handle located on the top of its receiver (under the carry handle), and a quick detachable [[suppressor]]. The [[weapon]] fires the proprietary 5.8×21mm [[ammunition|cartridge]].

An export variant of QCW-05 is dubbed [b]Js 9mm[/b], which is slightly smaller and fires 9×19mm Parabellum round.

h1. See also
* [[Js 9 (Girls' Frontline)]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h1. External links
* Wikipedia: "QCW-05":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/QCW-05#JS_9mm

title: st_kinetics_cpw
body:
The [b]CPW[/b] (Compact Personal Weapon) is a multi-caliber [[submachine gun]]/personal defense [[weapon]] developed by ST Kinetics of Singapore. The prototype is chambered in 9×19mm Parabellum, but its modular design allows for a simple caliber conversion to either 5.7×28mm or 4.6×30mm.

The CPW features a [[gun|handgun]]-like ergonomics, an angular trigger guard, as well as Picatinny rails on the top and bottom for mounting accessories like [[vertical foregrip]].

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* Wikipedia: "ST Kinetics CPW":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ST_Kinetics_CPW

title: drifting
body:
A [[driving]] and motorsport technique involving deliberately oversteering to cause loss of traction in the rear wheels during turns while maintaining vehicle control and a high exit speed.

Popularized by the [[Initial D]] manga and anime. [[Formula Drift]] is the premier motorsport championship for drifting in the United States (with a series in Japan as well), while [[D1 Grand Prix]] is the leading series in Japan.

h4. See also

* [[wheelie]]

title: 360_panorama
body:
A type of [[panorama]] showing the entire environment surrounding an observer.
To qualify, the opposing edges of the images need to be able to "link up" to create a continuous view.

Because a 360° image will be heavily distorted when viewed as a flat image, it's recommended to view these using an external tool to experience these images properly.

h4. External Links
* https://renderstuff.com/tools/360-panorama-web-viewer/

title: waga_seishun_no_arcadia
body:
[quote][i]"At the end of their lives, all men look back and think that their youth was [[Arcadia]]."[/i] — Goethe.[/quote] 

[b]Arcadia of My Youth[/b] is a 1982 anime film depicting the origin of [[Matsumoto Leiji]]'s seminal character Captain [[Harlock]]. It is set in the [[Harlock Saga]].

At one time, it was considered to be the central hub of the so-called "Leijiverse" with other works such as [[ginga_tetsudou_999|Galaxy Express 999]] and 1978's [[Uchuu Kaizoku Captain Harlock|Space Pirate Captain Harlock]] television series occurring sometime after. It is directed by Tomoharu Katsumata, with Kazuo Komatsubara as animation director.

h4.See also

* Captain [[Harlock]]
* [[Ooyama Toshiro]]
* [[Emeraldas]]
* [[Arcadia]]

title: julius_robert_oppenheimer
body:
[quote][i]"Now I Am Become Death, the Destroyer of Worlds...".[/i] - Oppenheimer, quoting the Hindi "Baghavad-Gita":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bhagavad_Gita after the success of the Trinity nuclear weapon test in summer, 1945.[/quote]

[b]Julius Robert Oppenheimer[/b] (April 22, 1904 – February 18, 1967) was an [[united states|American]] theoretical physicist and director of the Los Alamos Laboratory in New Mexico, U.S.A., during [[World War II]]. 

He is often credited as the [b]"father of the [[nuclear_weapon|atomic bomb]]"[/b] for his role in organizing the Manhattan Project.

h4. See also
* [[Oppenheimer (movie)]]
other_names: ロバート・オッペンハイマー

title: kaze_tachinu
body:
[quote][i]"The wind rises... We must try to live...!!!"[/i] - Paul Valéry, [i]The Graveyard By The Sea[/i].[/quote]

[i][b]Kaze Tachinu[/b][/i] (風立ちぬ [i]The Wind Rises[/i]) is a 2013 Japanese historical drama anime film written and directed by [[Miyazaki Hayao]], and animated by [[Studio Ghibli]]. 

It is the final feature film to date directed by Miyazaki, who announced his retirement in September 2013. The movie is a fictionalized biography of [[Horikoshi Jirou]], a Japanese designer of fighter planes used by the Empire of [[Japan]] during [[World War II]]. The film is adapted from Miyazaki's manga of the same name, which was in turn loosely based on the 1937 short story "The Wind Has Risen" by Hori Tatsuo.

The movie was released by Toho on July 20, 2013 in Japan and by Touchstone Pictures in North America, first with a limited release on February 21, 2014, then a wide release on February 28, 2014. The film was released in the UK on May 9, 2014.

h4. See also

* [[Satomi Naoko]]
* [[A5M]]
* [[A6M Zero]]
* "Wikipedia Page":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Wind_Rises

title: siege_of_sevastopol
body:
[B]The Siege of Sevastopol[/b] also known as [B]The Defense of Sevastopol[/b] (Russian: Оборона Севастополя, romanized: [i]Oborona Sevastopolya[/i]) or [b]The Battle of Sevastopol[/b] (German: [i]Schlacht um Sewastopol[/i]; Romanian: [i]Bătălia de la Sevastopol[/i]) was a [[military]] engagement that took place on the Eastern Front of [[World War II]]. 

The campaign was fought by the Axis powers of [[Germany]] and [[Romania]] against the [[Soviet Union]] for control of Sevastopol, a coastal city in Crimea on the Black Sea. On 22 June 1941 the Axis invaded the Soviet Union during "Operation Barbarossa":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Barbarossa . Axis land forces reached the Crimea in the autumn of 1941 and overran most of the area. The only objective not in Axis hands was Sevastopol. 

Several attempts were made to secure the port in October and November 1941. A major attack was planned for late November, but heavy rains delayed it until 17 December 1941. Under the command of [[Erich von Manstein]], Axis forces were unable to capture Sevastopol during this first operation. Soviet forces launched [[battle_of_the_kerch_peninsula|an amphibious landing on the Crimean peninsula at Kerch]] in December 1941 to relieve the siege and force the Axis to divert forces to defend their gains. The operation saved Sevastopol for the time being, but the bridgehead in the eastern Crimea was eliminated in May 1942.

After the failure of their first assault on Sevastopol, the Axis opted to conduct siege warfare until the middle of 1942, at which point they attacked the encircled Soviet forces by land, sea, and air. On 2 June 1942, the Axis began this operation, codenamed Störfang (Sturgeon Catch). The [[Soviet Army]] and the Black Sea Fleet of the [[Soviet Navy]] held out for weeks under intense Axis bombardment. The [[Luftwaffe]] played a vital part in the siege, its 8th Air Corps bombing the besieged Soviet forces with impunity, flying 23,751 sorties and dropping 20,528 tons of bombs in June alone. At the end of the siege, there were only 11 undamaged buildings left in Sevastopol. The Luftwaffe sank or deterred most Soviet attempts to evacuate their troops by sea. The German 11th Army suppressed and destroyed the defenders by firing 46,750 tons of artillery ammunition on them during Störfang.

Finally, on 4 July 1942, the remaining Soviet forces surrendered and the Germans seized the port. The Soviet Separate Coastal Army was annihilated, with 118,000 men killed, wounded or captured in the final assault and 200,481 casualties in the siege as a whole for both it and the Black Sea Fleet. Axis losses in Störfang amounted to 35,866 men, of whom 27,412 were German and 8,454 Romanian. With the Soviet forces neutralized, the Axis refocused their attention on the major summer campaign of that year, "Case Blue", and the advance to the Caucasus oilfields ("Baku":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baku) that led to the [[Battle of Stalingrad]].

title: gm_cannon_ii
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in the [[Gundam 0083]] OVA from 1991.

[b]RGC-83 GM Cannon II[/b]

A vastly improved version of the original [[GM Cannon]] [[mobile suit]], featuring a much more higher output reactor capable of powering twin beam cannons as opposed to a single shell-firing artillery gun and a beam saber, as well as a modified version of the [[Gundam Alex]]'s Chobham [[Reactive Armor]] package for great durability - however, the type paid for it dearly, being severely hindered in its mobility.

title: gerbera_tetra
body:

title: implied_after_fellatio
body:
The aftermath of [[implied fellatio]] or [[after fellatio]], when the [[fellatio]] act has almost certainly occurred, yet has never been directly spotted. This is usually due to [[out-of-frame censoring]], or a character [[facing away]] from the viewer until it's too late to be sure what actually happened, in spite of a few obvious hints.

Most often there is only one partner left alone and/or who's still carrying the last remaining visual cues (Ex: [[disheveled]], [[sunken cheeks]], unconvincingly acting like nothing happened, the presence of [[saliva on penis]]/[[stray pubic hair]] around the mouth, etc.)

It's often used with [[cum in mouth]] although this alone could simply indicate a [[facial]] without any penetration.

title: comedic_teardrop
body:
NEW TAG SUBMITION : Too much misuses of the previous name {{teardrop}}

-

A comical depiction of crying or tears. Very similar to [[sweatdrop]]. This tag is not meant to specify when there's one tear versus when there's more than one. Usually there is never more than one on a character's face.

Basically, comedic teardrop is used when the tear is drawn on for comedic purposes, rather than to actually represent happiness/sadness/pain/pleasure/etc. They usually have a specific color, rather than being transparent like real tears, and are usually connected directly to the eyes. A teardrop may also accompany [[yawning]].

Rule of thumb: if the character appears to be actually crying, or the teardrop is transparent, it is usually [i]not[/i] a teardrop. For all other instances of shedding tears that don't properly meet the requirements for teardrop, use [[tears]] instead.

For non-comedic pictures with a single teardrop, use [[single tear]].

h6. Examples of images with a comedic teardrop:

* post #512078
* post #514305
* post #524707

h6. Examples of images that shouldn't be tagged with comedic teardrop:

* post #514195
* post #509521
* post #104763

h4. See also:

* [[Tearing up]]
* [[Tears]]

title: glaug
body:
In the [[Macross]] franchise, a [[Zentradi]] [[alien]] one-man command aerospace [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]]. 

The [[Roiquonmi]] [b]Glaug[/b] walker is better armored and has much more powerful weaponry than the [[Esbeliben]] [[Regult]]. It is armed with 2 mid-range energy guns and 2 rapid firing close-range energy guns in its arms, 2 small anti-personnel laser cannons on both sides of its cockpit and one long-range anti-ship heavy plasma cannon at the top.

This mecha can also be equipped with an aerospace booster which greatly increases its speed while traveling through space and enables it to fly in an atmosphere at supersonic speeds. The booster is armed with 6 missile launchers with 2 medium sized missiles each.

Because of its rarity and power, the Glaug is usually assigned to high ranking Zentradi officers and fleet commanders. It is the mecha of choice for [[Quamzin Kravshera]].

In [[real life]] this fictional [[alien]] mecha was designed by [[Kawamori Shouji]] for the original [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] anime TV series from 1982. It was renamed as the [b]Officer's Battle Pod[/b] in the [[Robotech]] 1985 adaptation.

h4. See also

* [[Variable Glaug]]
* [[draug_(mecha)|Draug]]

title: vernier_thrusters
body:
A [b]vernier thruster[/b] is a rocket engine used on a [[spacecraft]] for fine adjustments to the direction, attitude or velocity of the vehicle. Depending on the design of a craft's maneuvering and stability systems, it may simply be a smaller thruster complementing the main propulsion system, it may complement larger attitude control thrusters or be a part of the main reaction control system. 

The name is derived from vernier calipers (named after mathematician "Pierre Vernier":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pierre_Vernier) which have a primary scale for gross measurements and a secondary scale for fine measurements.

title: raging_loop
body: Raging Loop is a Japanese visual novel with elements of supernatural horror & mystery heavily influenced by the social deduction game Werewolf (or Mafia). It follows [[Fusaishi Haruaki]] when he stumbles onto a remote rural Japanese village during a road trip. His pleasant times with the village's inhabitants are cut short when a dense & otherworldly fog prevents exit and the community is forced to out & hang the Werewolf/Werewolves among them who are given the authority to kill one of them each night. Their isolation will only end when either the humans or Werewolves are left standing victorious after having successfully slaughtered the other.

title: squidward_tentacles
body:
Squidward Tentacles is one of the main characters in the [[SpongeBob SquarePants (series)|]] franchise.

He is a grumpy, stoic, and straight-to-the-point octopus who lives next door with [[SpongeBob Squarepants]] and [[Patrick Star]]. He has a passion for fine arts and music, but his attempt of improving his craft is usually foiled by SpongeBob's antics, much to his anger and irritation. He is also SpongeBob's coworker at [[Mr. Krabs]]' Krusty Krabs restaurant and work there as the receptionist.

title: mr._krabs
body:
Eugene Harold Krabs, more commonly known as Mr. Krabs, is one of the main characters in the [[SpongeBob SquarePants (series)|]] franchise.

He is a miserly, greedy red crab who lives in an anchor with his daughter, Pearl, who is a young whale. He is the owner and founder of the Krusty Krab restaurant as well as the employer of both [[SpongeBob Squarepants]] and [[Squidward Tentacles]].

title: trauare_wrede
body:
Trauare is a girl from [[Rosenkreuzstilette]] who is a champion swimmer by nature, always having been competitive and belligerent. Her friends call her "Trau" for short. She is usually composed and aloof, as well as sharp-tongued and vindictive, and likes to focus on what needs to be done. She is also short-tempered - yet, her temper is even worse than her good friend [[Zorne Zeppelin|Zorne's]] when it's blown. She carries the Chaos Spear, Leviathan, which she uses to fight, and is easily noticeable for often being garbed in a blue [[competition swimsuit]], as well as a seashell for a hair ornament. Being a champion swimmer by nature, she loves to swim and will often invite Zorne (who also owns a competition swimsuit similar to hers) to join her at a nearby ravine in her spare time. In Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel, Trauare wears a darker blue [[China dress]] over her competition swimsuit. She is largely a tribute to [[Fairy leviathan (mega man)|Fairy Leviathan]] of [[Mega Man Zero (series)|]] fame, which her spear is similarly named to.

Her weapon is Klageharnisch, which lets her project tornadoes of water at her opponents. The weapon is similar to [[Air Man]]'s Air Shooter in [[Mega Man 2]].

title: fu_hua_(night_squire)
body:
Night Squire is one of [[Fu Hua]]'s available Valkyrja forms where she dons a blue shirt and tie with a white coat, along with black slacks and black glasses.

Other outfits include:

* Rustic Noir: A black, sleeveless shirt with white shorts and Chinese accents, omitting her glasses and letting her hair fully down, albeit with a single braid in the middle.
* Spring Traveler: A casual outfit with a green [[off-shoulder shirt]], black knee-length pants, a white and blue backpack, and a white beret that conceals most of her hair.
* Dark Butler: A pallette swap of her original outfit, where her shirt and coat are now black with yellow accents, and a yellow tie.
* Autumn Shades: A casual autumny outfit with a black shirt with a white leaf print and blue short shorts, with a Jingwei-chick backpack.

title: jeddah_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It appears in the [[Moon Gundam]] manga from 2017.

[b] RGM-88X Jeddah [/b]

An experimental prototype for the Federation's next generation mass produced [[mobile_suit|MS]] to replace the outdated [[GM III]]. The Jeddah's specifications were considered adequate, with even [[Amuro Ray]] giving his seal of approval for the design to be passed onwards, and as such it was further refined and simplified into the venerable [[Jegan]].

title: kerberos_saga
body:
A Japanese alternate history political thriller franchise created by [[oshii mamoru|Mamoru Oshii]], stemming from his 1987 film [[akai megane|The Red Spectacles]]. 

It is set in an alternate timeline where the [[United States]] remained neutral during both world wars, and during [[World War II]], [[Japan]] joined the Allies, [[nazi|Germany]] defeated the [[soviet|Soviet Union]] (largely from their development of the [[protect gear|protect gears]]), and the 20 July plot to assassinate [[Adolf Hitler]] succeeded, leading to the restoration of the Weimar Republic. After the war, a de-nazified but still authoritarian Germany occupies Japan, leading to anti-government riots and terrorism. 

To combat the civil unrest, the Japanese provisional government set up a special counter-terrorist unit within the [[Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department]] known as the Capital Police Special Unit "Kerberos," who use the [[protect gear|protect gears]] developed by the Germans during [[World War II]].

h4. Installments
* [[akai megane|The Red Spectacles]] (1987, live-action)
* StrayDog: Kerberos Panzer Cops (1991, live-action)
* [[jin-roh|Jin-Roh: The Wolf Brigade]] (1999, anime)

h4. See also
* [[Protect Gear]]
* [[Wolfenstein (series)|]]
* [[The Man In The High Castle]]

title: jin-roh
body:
A 1999 anime feature film directed by Hiroyuki Okiura, and written by [[Oshii Mamoru]] as part of Oshii's [[Kerberos Saga]] universe.

A prequel to the 1987 film [[akai megane|The Red Spectacles]], the film is set in an [[kerberos saga|alternate outcome of WWII]] during the 1950s after Germany withdrew Japan and the post-war government deals with anti-government riots and terrorism. The main protagonist, [[fuse kazuki|Kazuki Fuse]], is a member of the elite [[protect gear|Kerberos Panzer Cops]], the Tokyo metropolitan counter-terrorism unit.

h4. See also

* [[Kerberos Saga]]

The seventeenth/[[Chinese clothes]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Tsukino Mito]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/MitoTsukino/status/1644293960104570884], unveiled on April 5, 2023, in conjunction with the release of "her rendition":[https://youtu.be/PvCfdTJGVcw] of Monkey Majik's single [i]Around the World[/i],

It consists of a [[floral print|floral]] and [[cloud print]] [[red dress]] with [[wide sleeves]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[red footwear|red]] [[shoes]]. Her hair is tied into [[double bun]]s and long [[twin braids]] held by [[white bow]]s and has [[red hair|red]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] ends. Her red dress and shoes also have an alternate [[blue dress|blue]] [[blue footwear|color]].
other_names: 月ノ美兎(チャイナ最高)

title: tequila
body:
A distilled alcoholic beverage made from the cooked, fermented sap of a succulent plant called blue agave. [b]Tequila[/b] comes in an abundant array of colors that ranges from a simple clear distilled beverage to a dark amber brown. Originally made in a town called Tequila about 50 km northwest from Guadalajara, [[Mexico]], its production has expanded into other places with similar climate such as Arandas.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

* [[Tequila Gundam]]

title: geara_zulu
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

[b]AMS-129 Geara Zulu[/b]

The successor to the older [[Geara Doga]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] - cheap, reliable and easy to produce and pilot, in line with its distant ancestor, the [[Zaku]]. Its head has been redesigned and resembles a [i][[Stahlhelm]][/i] with a gas mask shaped vent, and its improved beam machine gun seems heavily inspired by the [[StG 44]]. 

While not cutting edge by any stretch of the imagination, it's still a serviceable, solid MS for [[Full Frontal]]'s Sleeves - his personal brand of [[Neo Zeon]].

title: akihabara_(tokyo)
body:
Akihabara (秋葉原), also known as Akihabara Electric Town (秋葉原電気街, Akihabara Denki Gai) or simply Akiba (アキバ), is an area of [[Chiyoda (tokyo)|]]. While there is an official locality named Akihabara nearby, the area known to most people as Akihabara is actually Soto-Kanda, a part of Chiyoda-ku.

Akihabara is a major [[shopping]] area for electronics, anime, and [[otaku]] goods.

h4. External links
* "Official website":http://www.akiba.or.jp/english/
* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Akihabara

title: pirate
body:
A maritime bandit and outlaw whose their [i]modus operandi[/i] is to raid and steal valuable goods from passerby ships, and oftentimes even capturing the ship for themselves. While piracy is prevalent around the world up until late 19th century, the most well-known pirates are the European and American pirates that operated around the Atlantic ocean between 15th to 18th century, of which the popular culture depiction of pirates in media is derived from.

title: matsumoto_leiji
body:
[b]Matsumoto Leiji[/b] (松本 零士, Matsumoto Reiji?, born Matsumoto Akira, January 25, 1938 — February 13, 2023) was a well-known creator of several classic anime and manga series.

Matsumoto was born in January 25, 1938 in Kurume, Fukuoka. He was the middle child of a family of seven brothers, and, in his early childhood, Matsumoto was given a 35mm film projector by his father, and watched American cartoons during the Pacific War. During this time, he gained an interest in science fiction novels by authors Unno Juza and H. G. Wells. At 18, he moved to Tokyo, to become a manga artist.

Matsumoto made his debut under his real name, Matsumoto Akira, in 1953. He would have his big break with Otoko Oidon, a series that chronicled the life of a rōnin (a young man who was preparing himself for entrance examinations to universities and colleges), in 1971. Around the same time he started a series of unconnected short stories set during [[World War II]], the "Senjou Manga Series", which would eventually become popular under the title [[The Cockpit]]. A year later in 1972 he radically changed genres and published a [[cowboy western]] manga called [[gun_frontier_(western)|Gun Frontier]]. 
 
He was later involved in several [[Science fiction]] works including [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]] (1974) and the debut of the highly popular series Captain [[Harlock]] and Galaxy Express 999 (both in 1977). In 1978, he was awarded the Shogakukan Manga Award for shōnen for Galaxy Express 999 and his Senjou Manga Series. Animated versions of Captain Harlock and Galaxy Express 999 are set in the same universe, which spanned several spin offs and related series, most notably [[Queen Emeraldas]] and Queen Millennia.

Matsumoto supervised the creation of several music videos for the French house group [[Daft Punk]], set to tracks from their album Discovery. These videos were issued end-to-end (making a full-length animated movie) on a DVD release titled [[Interstella 5555]]: The 5tory of the 5ecret 5tar 5ystem.

About two dozen bronze statues — each perhaps four feet tall — of characters and scenes from Space Battleship Yamato and Galaxy Express 999 were erected in the downtown area of Tsuruga in 1999. Each statue includes a plaque at its base explaining the character, and featuring Matsumoto's signature.

Matsumoto worked with Nishizaki Yoshinobu on Space Battleship Yamato (known outside Japan under various names but most commonly as Star Blazers). Matsumoto created a manga loosely based on the series, and the Yamato makes cameo appearances (sans crew) in several of his works including the Galaxy Express 999 manga.

A work by Matsumoto called Great Yamato featuring an updated Yamato had to be renamed Great Galaxy due to legal issues with Nishizaki. As of 2009, Matsumoto and Nishizaki were working on independent anime projects featuring the acclaimed Space Battleship Yamato, with the conditions that Matsumoto cannot use the name Yamato or the plot or characters from the original, and Nishizaki cannot use the conceptual art, character or ship designs of the original. Since Nishizaki's death in 2010, it is uncertain whether these restrictions will continue to apply.

His wife is shōjo manga artist Maki Miyako (better known as the creator of the doll [[Super Doll Licca-chan]], the Japanese equivalent of Barbie). Matsumoto passed away in February 13, 2023 due to acute heart failure. According to his daughter [i]"he now rests in the sea of stars...".[/i]

h4.Famous works

* [[Harlock Saga]]
* [[Uchuu Senkan Yamato]]
* [[Ginga Tetsudou 999]]
* [[shin_taketori_monogatari_sennen_joou|Queen Millennia]]
* [[Queen Emeraldas]]
* [[The Cockpit]]
* [[gun_frontier_(western)|Gun Frontier]]

h4.See also

* [[Matsumoto Leiji (style)]]

title: queen_emeraldas
body:
[b]Queen Emeraldas[/b]  is a four-episode Japanese anime OVA from 1998 that continues the [[Harlock Saga]] franchise created by [[Matsumoto Leiji]]. The anime was adapted from Matsumoto's 1978 manga of the same name. 

It is the story of the [[space]] [[pirate]] [[spacecraft]], [i]Queen Emeraldas[/i], which is captained by the mysterious and beautiful [[Emeraldas]].

title: dag_doll
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeared in the [[Moon Gundam]] series from 2017.

[b]AMX-015-4S Dag Doll[/b]

A large Newtype use [[mobile_Suit|MS]] developed by [[Neo Zeon]]. Geared towards maximum firepower, it is a direct successor to the mighty [[Geymalk]], albeit doing away with the hordes of child and mother funnels for only five regular funnels aided by a vastly more powerful psycommu system (although using it in its full power configuration, referred to as "Machine Head Mode" was greatly straining on any pilot), as well as the Dag Leader, a development of the [[Adzam]] Leader capable of disabling any MS caught in its electromagnetic field. 

The hand cannons of the Geymalk were replaced with regular manipulators as well, which enabled the Dag Doll to carry a long beam rifle capable of emitting a massive beam blade for close combat. Unlike many other Neo Zeon ace mecha, the Dag Doll has a white paint scheme.

title: varguil
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Gundam]]. It first appeared in the [[Moon Gundam]] manga series from 2017.

[b]AMS-123X Varguil[/b] 

The Varguil is a prototype [[Neo Zeon]] [[mobile suit]] intended for use by Newtypes. Is basically a powered down prototype of the more advanced [[Sazabi]] intended for mass production.

It is piloted by [[Agos Lagarto]].

h4. See also
* [[Moon Gundam (Mobile Suit)]]

title: moon_gundam_(mobile_suit)
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] universe. It first appeared in the [[Moon Gundam]] manga from 2017.

[b]AMS-123X-X Moon Gundam[/b]

A makeshift Newtype use [[mobile_suit|MS]] created on the "Moon Moon" [[space_station|space colony]] with [[neo_zeon|Axis]] technology. It is essentially the [[Varguil]], in itself a prototype for the [[Sazabi]], with the [[Psycho Gundam Mk-IV G-Doors]]'s head and Psycho-Plates, though enough of them were missing that the resulting machine appeared as if it carried a crescent moon on its back.

title: zuiyin
body: A zuiyin (罪印) is a cursed mark that indicates that somebody has succumbed to darkening or their so called heart demons (心魔). The term translates to criminal seal or mark of sin. It is often depicted as a [[flame_print|flame-shaped print]] and can change in shape and form depending on the possessor's mental state, sometimes expanding throughout their entire body.

title: space_needle
body:
A famous landmark in Seattle, Washington, built for the 1962 World's Fair. An elevator leads visitors to the viewing deck and restaurant.

Most pictures of it are taken from Queen Anne Hill facing south toward downtown. In real life, it is shorter than most of the downtown buildings and is placed quite a distance away from them.

title: large_cruiser
body:
Large Cruisers, as stated, are larger than Heavy Cruisers and carry Heavier guns (Battleship Guns) and known as "Cruiser Killers" in the second world war. These cruisers are designed to fight off Heavy Cruisers and Battleships.

To identify a Large Cruiser, the minimum millimeter is 254 (25.4cm) and the maximum is 380 (38cm)
 
Classified Acronym is CB (Cruiser Battleship/Large Cruiser/Super Heavy Cruiser)

The Gun Caliber of each Large Cruiser represents:

1. 254mm (25.4cm)
2. 283mm (28.3cm)
3. 305mm (30.5cm)
4. 320mm (32cm)
5. 356mm (35.6cm)
6. 380mm (38cm)

title: tachibana_miya
body:
Younger sister of [[Tachibana Jun'ichi]] in [[Amagami]]. Has a distinctive laugh (ni-shi-shi-shi). She is friends with [[Nakata Sae]] & [[Nanasaki Ai]].

Her extra ending in the game:[spoilers]"Miya/Imouto End" happens if you raise certain flags with her and if you fail to get with any girls. On Christmas, she finds a kitten. Junichi goes with her to find her mommy cat. He saves the mom cat from being run over. Miya and Junichi see the kitten and mom cat playfully bite each other (amagami!). Tachibana explains amagami is a form of affection. Miya bites Junichi to show how much she loves her 'nii-nii'.[/spoilers]

She has [[brown eyes]], [[small breasts]], and [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[bangs]]. Her [[Kibito High School Uniform]] consists of a [[black jacket]], [[black sailor collar]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

She is voiced by [[Asumi Kana]] in the anime.

h4. See Also

* "Amagami Wiki: Tachibana Miya":https://amagami.fandom.com/wiki/Miya_Tachibana

title: star_seed_(sailor_moon)
body:
An important object only seen in the last story arc of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. A small diamond-shaped crystal (technically a hexagonal dipyramid) surrounded by a circular glow. According to the series' lore, every living entity throughout the universe has a Star Seed, commonly depicted with a pale white color. Planetary guardians possess True Star Seeds that are colored according to each planet's theme color, such as with the [[Sailor Senshi]], as well as [[Chiba Mamoru]] since he is Earth's guardian.

[[Sailor Galaxia]]'s goal is to collect all of the Star Seeds in the universe so she can become the strongest Sailor Senshi in existence.

title: yaten_kou
body:
The white-haired member of the Three Lights who transforms into [[Sailor Star Healer]]. Yaten is often aloof and wishes to find [[Princess Kakyuu]] as soon as possible so they can leave Earth. The treatment of the Sailor Starlights radically differs between the original manga and the 90s anime, with the trio being able to transform into men in the anime when this did not exist in the manga.

She is voiced by Sakamoto Chika in the 90s anime, and by [[Sakura Ayane]] in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Crystal]].

title: taiki_kou
body:
One of the Sailor Starlights who is very intellectual and rivals [[Mizuno Ami]]'s wits. Ami tries to teach Taiki about having dreams. She transforms into [[Sailor Star Maker]]. The treatment of the Sailor Starlights radically differs between the original manga and the 90s anime, with the trio being able to transform into men in the anime when this did not exist in the manga.

She is voiced by the late Tsunoda Narumi in the 90s anime, and by [[Hayami Saori]] in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Crystal]].

title: bishoujo_senshi_sailor_moon_crystal
body:
A summer 2014 adaptation of the [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] franchise, commemorating the series' 20th anniversary. Sailor Moon Crystal isn't a remake of the previous 1992-1997 series. Rather, it is more faithful to the manga's storyline. The first two arcs, the Dark Kingdom and Black Moon arcs, aired from July 2014 to July 2015. The third arc, Death Busters, aired in 2016. The fourth arc, Dead Moon, was released as a two-part film in 2021. The fifth and final arc, Shadow Galactica, was likewise released as a two-part film in 2023.

This tag is to be used if there is a direct reference to BSSMC such as a [[voice actor connection]], an artist using the [[official style]], or depicting a scene that happens in the show.

h4.Voice actors

* [[Aino Minako]]/[[Sailor Venus]] - [[Itou Shizuka]]
* [[Chibi Usa]]/[[Sailor Chibi Moon]] - [[Fukuen Misato]]
* [[Hino Rei]]/[[Sailor Mars]] - [[Satou Rina]]
* [[Kaiou Michiru]]/[[Sailor Neptune]] - [[Oohara Sayaka]]
* [[Kino Makoto]]/[[Sailor Jupiter]] - [[Koshimizu Ami]]
* [[Meiou Setsuna]]/[[Sailor Pluto]] - Maeda Ai
* [[Mizuno Ami]]/[[Sailor Mercury]] - [[Kanemoto Hisako]]

body:

Seiya is the black-haired member who gains feelings for [[Tsukino Usagi|Usagi]], even though she is waiting for [[Chiba Mamoru|Mamoru]] to return from America. Seiya transforms into [[Sailor Star Fighter]]. The treatment of the Sailor Starlights radically differs between the original manga and the 90s anime, with the trio being able to transform into men in the anime when this did not exist in the manga.

She is voiced by Niiyama Shiho in the 90s anime, and by [[Inoue Marina]] in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Crystal]].

title: princess_kakyuu
body: The princess of a distant planet named Kinmoku. The Sailor Starlights are trying to find her in the anime. In the manga, she can transform into [[Sailor Kakyuu]]. She is voiced by [[Tamagawa Sakiko]] in the 90s anime, and by [[Mizuki Nana]] in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Crystal]].

title: chibi_chibi
body:
The dark pink-haired character from the manga and anime [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]] (aka. Pretty Soldier Sailor Moon) by [[Takeuchi Naoko]].

She was the civilian identity of [[Sailor Chibi Chibi|Sailor Chibi Chibi Moon]]. Her appearance was that of a very young child, with red hair set in two heart-shaped [[double bun]]s, and blue eyes.  Chibi Chibi's vocabulary was limited to a few simple words and repeating what other people said. The most frequently used was "Chibi" (hence her name). Her true form is that of [[Sailor Cosmos]].

She is voiced by [[Mitsuishi Kotono]] in both the 90s anime and [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Crystal]].

h4. External links

* "Wikimoon: Chibi Chibi":https://www.wikimoon.org/index.php?title=Chibi_Chibi

title: sailor_galaxia
body: The main villain of the final arc in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. Galaxia is the strongest Sailor Senshi who had her mind and body corrupted by Chaos, but [[Sailor Moon]] purifies her in the end. [spoiler]In the 90s anime, Chibi Chibi is revealed to be Galaxia's personified Star Seed.[/spoiler] In [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Crystal]], her story remains more faithful to the manga, seeking to have [[Eternal Sailor Moon]] fight Chaos to a mutual death, leaving her to become the strongest Sailor Senshi in the universe. She is voiced by Horie Mitsuko in the 90s anime, and by [[Hayashibara Megumi]] in [i]Crystal[/i]. Hayashibara previously voiced [[Nayotake Himeko]] from the 90s anime's second movie.

title: alma_(f.e.a.r.)
body:
One of the main antagonists in the [[f.e.a.r.]] series. She alternates between playfully toying with the protagonist and attempting rend the flesh from his bones. She is commonly shown in two forms: a young girl with a red dress, which is how she is shown in the first-game, and as a young adult with pale skin and burn marks in the second-game.

[spoiler] One of the final reveals in the game is that she is the daughter of Harlan Wade - the scientist who conducted research on her - and the mother of [[point man (f.e.a.r.)|the protagonist]] of the first game. [/spoiler]

title: dragon_dance
body:
([i]wǔ lóng[/i])

The [i]dragon dance[/i], like the [[lion dance]], is a form of traditional dance in Chinese culture and other Asian countries. It is most often seen in festive celebrations. The dance is performed by a team of experienced dancers who manipulate a long flexible figure of a dragon using poles positioned at regular intervals along the length of the dragon. The dance team simulates the imagined movements of this river spirit in a sinuous, undulating manner.

Lion dance is sometimes mistakenly referred to as dragon dance, the most significant difference is that a dragon dance is usually a lot longer, and operated via sticks. Lion dance often only requires one or two operators, who wear or carry it directly. See post #5041424 for comparison.

h4.External links

* "Dragon dance Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragon_dance

title: z_flag
body:
One of the international maritime [[signal_flag|signal flags]]. It is a square divided diagonally into four triangles, colored yellow, blue, red, and black. Also referred in NATO alphabet as "Zulu flag" (not the actual flag of the Zulu kingdom).

It represents the letter Z when communicating by individual letters. Combined with four number flags, it represents the time in UTC. On its own, it may mean "I require a tug" or "I am shooting nets".

The Z flag is of special significance in the context of Japanese naval history due to its role in the Battle of Tsushima where it was raised on the flagship [[mikasa_(battleship)|Mikasa]]. In this battle, the Z flag was understood to mean, "The fate of the Empire rests on the outcome of this battle. Let each man do his utmost". However, the flag has gradually gained more notoriety after it was used as a signal flag of the Attack on [[Pearl Harbor]] on board the flagship [[Akagi (aircraft carrier)|]], along with being a battle flag in several major engagements in [[World War II]] (including the last voyage of the battleship [[Yamato (battleship)|]] during [[Operation Ten-Gou]]). As a result, much like the [[imperial war flag|Imperial German war flag]], it has turned into a symbol for far-right Japanese ultranationalism.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Z flag":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Z_flag

title: artisanship_commission_uniform_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
The uniform of workers of the Artisanship Commission on Xianzhou Luofu in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Predominantly worn by NPCs in that area, though despite not being depicted as such in canon, [[Yingxing (honkai: star rail)|]] is occasionally shown in that uniform in fanworks due to his position at the Artisanship Commission.

The most notable element of the uniform is the [[red jacket]], which features a golden pattern that resembles [[seigaiha]] on the bottom of its sleeves.

This phrase became a meme on the Japanese internet because while it's true that while [spoilers]Maki's rebellion against the Zen'in clan[/spoilers] is considered an outrageous act, Naoya is a character with many reprehensible character flaws who should not be condemning others.

title: bismarck_(battleship)
body:
[[Battleship]] of the [[Kriegsmarine]] in [[World War II]], named after German statesman [[Otto von Bismarck]]. 

h4. History

The historical Bismarck's best known action was the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_the_Denmark_Strait](Battle of the Denmark Strait) on 25 May 1941, in which her and [i][[Prinz Eugen (cruiser)|]][/i] were engaged by the Royal Navy. However, they managed to fend them off, famously detonating the magazines of [i][[HMS Hood]][/i] in the process. This defeat prompted Royal Navy to launch a manhunt campaign against Bismarck, who had been ordered to head to occupied France due to the damage suffered during the battle. 

On 28 May 1941, 3 days after the sinking of the Hood, Bismarck suffered a hit to her propulsion system from a biplane torpedo bomber [[Fairey Swordfish]] launched from [[hms ark royal (91)|HMS Ark Royal]], which allowed British battleships HMS [i]King George V[/i], HMS [i]Rodney[/i], heavy cruisers HMS [i]Norfolk[/i], HMS [i]Suffolk[/i], and destroyers [i]Cossack, Sikh, Maori, Zulu[/i] and Polish destroyer ORP [i]Piorun[/i] (the latter repeatedly flashing "I AM A POLE" to her via signal light) to catch up with and ultimately sink her. On the morning of May 27, at 0847 hours, HMS [i]Rodney[/i], followed quickly by [i]King George V[/i], opened fire on [i]Bismarck[/i], which had been more or less completely immobilized by this point, by 0931, all of [i]Bismarck's[/i] guns had been silenced and she had been reduced to floating wreck incapable of fighting back. Ultimately [i]Bismarck[/i] started to capsize around 1035 hours and disappeared beneath the waves a few minutes later with few survivors.

In 2019, Swedish power metal band [[sabaton (band)|Sabaton]] released a single titled [i]"Bismarck":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oVWEb-At8yc&vl=en-US][/i] about said battleship, which also happened to coincide with the "announcement of Bismarck being added to Azur Lane":[https://twitter.com/AzurLane_EN/status/1126879577207271424].

h4. See also

* [[Bismarck (Kancolle)]]
* [[Bismarck (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Bismarck (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[Bismarck (Black Surge Night)]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "German battleship Bismarck":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_battleship_Bismarck

title: tequila_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] universe.

The [b]GF13-049NM Tequila Gundam[/b] is a [[mobile_suit|mobile fighter]] that appears in the TV anime [b][i]Mobile Fighter [[G Gundam]][/i][/b].

It is piloted by [[Chico Rodriguez]] from Neo [[Mexico]] and is named after [[tequila|the popular Mexican beverage of the same name]]. It is an amphibious-type specially designed for underwater combat. While its defensive capabilities are relatively poor, the Tequila Gundam can block attacks with the reinforced armor on its shoulders and forearms. it is capable of launching the spikes on its right shoulder armor like [[missile]]s, and can also detach and propel its hat at opponents.

The "[[hat]]" structure is armed with several Vulcan guns capable of firing in all directions. It is also armed with a [[beam trident]] and a special weapon called the "[[Tequila]] Vortex" mounted atop of the hat structure: The [[sombrero]]-like structure houses a rotating fan, which allows the Tequila Gundam to create a powerful [[whirlpool]] and pull enemy mobile fighters into the water.

title: francisco_goya
body:
"フランシスコ・デ・ゴヤ":https://www.pixiv.net/tags/%E3%83%95%E3%83%A9%E3%83%B3%E3%82%B7%E3%82%B9%E3%82%B3%E3%83%BB%E3%83%87%E3%83%BB%E3%82%B4%E3%83%A4/artworks?s_mode=s_tag

[b]Francisco José de Goya y Lucientes[/b] (/ˈɡɔɪə/; Spanish: [fɾanˈθisko xoˈse ðe ˈɣoʝa i luˈθjentes]; 30 March 1746 – 16 April 1828), known also as [b]Francisco de Goya[/b], [b]Francisco Goya[/b] or simply [b]Goya[/b], was a [[spain|Spanish]] romantic painter and printmaker. He is considered the most important Spanish artist of the late 18th and early 19th centuries. 

His paintings, drawings, and engravings reflected contemporary historical upheavals as well as [[fantasy]] scenarios. His art also influenced important 19th- and 20th-century painters. Goya is often referred to as the last of the Old Masters and the first of the moderns.

h4. Some of his works:
* [[witches'_sabbath_(francisco_goya)|Witches' Sabbath]]
* [[Saturn Devouring his Son]]
* [[La Maja Vestida]]
* [[La Maja Desnuda]]
* [[Duelo a Garrotazos]]

title: miracle_snack_shop
body:
A spin-off, visual novel adaptation of a Korean web novel with the same name. Developed by [[talesshop]], and released in December 2018. The main lead artist is [[Ukero]].

In the game, playing as [[Cha Seol-hwa]], a guy who's been through a lot in the past and currently running a small snack shop, you get to meet both female leads while managing your business. One is [[Philia Salis]], who came from a mysterious portal appeared in your attic. She is an exotic woman with a royal personality and introduces her as Salt Queen, the ruler of Salt kingdom of her world. The other is [[Joo Mi-ra]], a former rookie editor from a local TV station, now aiming to be a big Youtuber, but struggling with low views and having to hide her current life from her family.

The game provides each different endings based on your choices and how financially well you manage your shop, but the DLC ultimately indicates that the Philia route is the canon storyline.

title: duelo_a_garrotazos
body:
[b]Fight with Cudgels[/b] (Spanish: [b]Riña a Garrotazos[/b] or [b]Duelo a Garrotazos[/b]), called [b]The Strangers[/b] or [b]Cowherds[/b] in the inventories, is the name given to a painting by [[spain|Spanish]] artist [[Francisco Goya]], now in the Museo del Prado, [[Madrid]]. 

One of the series of Black Paintings Goya painted directly onto the walls of his house sometime between 1820 and 1823, it depicts two men fighting one another with cudgels, as they seem to be trapped knee-deep in a quagmire of mud or sand.

Three or above characters [[costume switch|interchanging their costumes]]. This requires all characters to involve in the [i]same[/i] switch, hence multiple pairs of 1v1 switches don't count as a "group switch".

h4. See also

* [[group hairstyle switch]]

body:

h4. See also

title: hairstyle_switch
body:
When two characters sport each other's usual hairstyle. They don't necessarily have to be switching their hair length as well.

If only one character is present, use [[borrowed hairstyle]] instead.

If the character [i]only[/i] switched their hair length but not their hairstyle, use [[hair length switch]] instead. If the characters switched [i]both their hairstyle and hair length[/i], use this tag and [[hair length switch]] together. 

h4. See also:

* [[personality switch]]
* [[costume switch]]
* [[role reversal]]
* [[group hairstyle switch]]
* [[tag group:artistic license]]

title: dragon_girl
body:
A female character with a dragon-like appearance.

For actual dragons, use the [[dragon]] tag instead (though there may or may not be overlap if [[personification]]/[[humanization]] is at play).

A particularly famous kind of dragon girl (or boy) is the [[Fire Emblem]] "manakete" or "mamkute" (マムクート); the games typically include at least one such character, often playable, who can transform from a human form into a full dragon, with the prominence of draconic features varying between each example. For ease of sorting, a separate "manakete" tag should not be made and all such characters should be sorted into the appropriate dragon-person tag.

h4. See also

* [[dragon boy]]
* [[dragon ears]]
* [[dragon horns]]
* [[dragon tail]]
* [[dragon wings]]

title: meiner_grand_(racehorse)
body:
Japanese [[horse|racehorse]]. Sired by [[Gold Ship (racehorse)|]] and foaled by Meine Nouvelle (this makes him a younger brother to [[Meine Theresia (racehorse)|]] and thus, an uncle to [[Uberleben (racehorse)|]]).

While he started as an unfortunate runner on flat, his fortune changed when he switched to steeple-chase. He won his first race and eventually became unbeaten in 2023, culminating in his crushing victory at the 2023 Nakayama Daishogai. He thus became Gold Ship's second progeny to obtain a G1 title of some form.

title: kyubey
body:
Also known by [i]QB[/i], Kyubey is one of the main characters [spoiler]and later revealed as the main antagonist[/spoiler] from [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]].

They are a "Messenger of Magic" (魔法の使者 mahou no shisha) who grants the wishes of young girls, but in exchange contracts their services as Puella Magi (魔法少女, mahou shoujo, lit. Magical Girls). Girls who form a contract with them are tasked to defeat [[Witch (madoka magica)|]]es -- bizarre entities that feed upon the hopes and dreams of normal people.

[spoiler]However, unbeknownst to the Magical Girls, Witches were actually a corrupted form of Magical Girls who were either killed in battle or eventually have their [[Soul Gem]] tainted over time and transforms into [[Grief Seed]] after consecutive encounters with Witches. Kyubey intentionally withheld this specific detail to create a millennia of cycle of war between Magical Girls and Witches in order to harvest the magical energy of these clashes for the benefit of their race. Their indifference to death and suffering upon the revelation of this fact upon [[Kaname Madoka]] has led to fans creating numerous hate arts subjecting them to various physical abuses.[/spoiler]

Kyubey is a four legged, white, fox-like [[alien]] with round [[red eyes]], and the unchanging facial expression [[:3|/人◕ ‿‿ ◕人\]]. Appearance and name share an affinity with [[kyuubi]].

Voiced by [[Katou Emiri]] (Japanese) / [[Cassandra Lee Morris]] (English).

h4. See also
* [[Juubey (Madoka Magica)|]] ([[Mahou Shoujo Kazumi Magica|Kazumi Magica]]-only member of the species)
* [[Small Kyubey]] ([[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden|Magia Record]]-only member of the species)

h4. External links

* "Puella Magi Wiki: Kyuubey":[http://wiki.puella-magi.net/Kyuubey]

title: yakisoba
body:
Fried [[noodles]] with their origin in Chinese chow mein with many variations flavored with Worcestershire sauce, salt and [[soy sauce]]. The most common variety is sauce yakisoba flavored with Worcestershire sauce and it has especially deep associations with [[summer festival]]s and seaside [[restaurant]]s called "海の家 ([i]Umi no Ie[/i]).":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B5%B7%E3%81%AE%E5%AE%B6 

There is also an instant type of yakisoba called cup yakisoba. Contrary to the name, it is not actually fried. For this type of food, use [[yakisoba]],  [[instant soba]], and [[cup ramen]] tags.

h4. See also

* [[yakisoba spill]]
* [[yakisobapan]]
* [[italian (niigata)]]
* [[noodles]]
* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Yakisoba":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yakisoba

title: mami_mogu_mogu
body:
Posts with explicit reference to [spoiler]the death scene of [[Tomoe Mami]][/spoiler] in Episode 3 of [i][[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]][/i].

[spoiler]The scene involves an apparently victorious Mami having her head chomped and [[decapitation|decapitated]] by the [[witch (madoka magica)|]] [[Charlotte_(madoka_magica)|]]'s true form. This scene acts as a plot twist due to the first two episodes depicts a typical lighthearted magical girl story tones, wheas the rest of the story would gradually turned into a gritty dark fantasy.[/spoiler]

The general depictions are:

* [spoiler]A body hanging in the air with the head out of frame.[/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[Charlotte_(madoka_magica)|]]'s mouth is wide open, ready to chomp somebody.[/spoiler]
* [spoiler][[Tomoe Mami|Mami]] loses or having lost  her head, one way or another.[/spoiler]

This tag is loosely translated into [spoiler]"Mami chomp"[/spoiler], with "mogu mogu" as the onomatopoeia for [spoiler]chewing.[/spoiler] The name came from the runes appeared during "Charlotte's labyrinth scene":https://images.puella-magi.net/8/86/Episode_3_runes.jpg.

Because of the nature of this tag, please add the {{spoilers}} tag as appropriate.

The related Japanese terms are:

* マミる (Mami-ru, to be Mami'd)
** Nicopedia article: http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4557586 
** Verbs of this form may be transitive or intransitive; e.g. 取る is transitive and 判る is intransitive.  Both of the Japanese wiki articles cited indicate that マミる is an intransitive verb.
* マミられる (Mami-rareru, to be Mami'd; alternate & much less common version)
* マミった (Mami-tta, has been Mami'd; past tense of Mamiru)

title: pandoro
body:
A traditional Italian sweet [[bread]] that originated in Verona. Its name is "golden bread" in Italian – [i]pan d'oro[/i] – but compressed into a single word, and it is traditionally shaped like a frustum with an eight-pointed star section. It is often served dusted with vanilla-scented icing sugar to evoke the image of the snowy peaks of the Italian Alps during Christmas, where it is most popular along with New Year.

h5. Related
* [i]Tag Group[/i]: [[Tag Group:Food Tags|Food Tags]]
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pandoro]

title: panettone_(food)
body:
An Italian sweet [[bread]] or fruitcake that originated in Milan. Its name is the Italian term for "large bread", and it is made during a long process that involves curing dough that is acidic, similar to sourdough, in a proofing process alone takes several days, giving the cake its distinctive fluffiness. It typically is cupola-shaped and contains candied orange, citron, and lemon zest along with raisins, which are added dry and not soaked, but there are variations. 

It became Italy's leading Christmas sweet by the end of World War II, but it is also prepared for Christmas and New Year in Western, Southern, and Southeastern Europe, as well as in South America, Eritrea, Australia, the United States and Canada – often in places where Lombard immigrants introduced the recipe.

h5. Related
* [i]Tag Group[/i]: [[Tag Group:Food Tags|Food Tags]]
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panettone]

title: hashima_renge_(ryou@ryou)
body:
Hashima Renge is an [[original]] character of [[Ryou@Ryou]] who appears in the artist's [i]蓮華草[/i] / [i]Renge Sou[/i] series of ero-doujin (titled after a "type of flower":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Astragalus_sinicus]).  She is a friend of [[hinata-kun_(ryou@ryou)|Hinata-kun]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] held back with a [[hairclip]] that often [[hair_over_one_eye|covers]] one of her [[red eyes]]. She has [[small breasts]].  She typically wears a [[serafuku]] [[school uniform]] with a [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[skirt]], [[blue sailor collar]] either a [[white shirt]] with [[blue neckerchief]], or a [[blue shirt]] with a [[white neckerchief]]. She also either [[black_socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] or a [[black pantyhose]].

As a character, she is frequently [[bullying|bullied]] and [[bondage|tied up]] in [[shibari]].

title: k2_black_panther
body:
The [b]K2 Black Panther[/b] is a [[South Korea]]n [[tank|main battle]] [[tank]] manufactured by "Hyundai Rotem":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hyundai_Rotem. 

The design began in 1995 to meet the strategic requirements of the [[Republic of Korea Army]]'s reform for three-dimensional, high-speed maneuver warfare based on use of network-centric [[war]]fare.

Mass production commenced in 2013, and the first K2s were deployed with the South Korean [[military|armed forces]] in July 2014. 

h4. See also
* [[List of ground vehicles]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: K2 Black Panther":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K2_Black_Panther]
